intro: Harpullia petiolaris, commonly known as the broadleaf hibiscus, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia and is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Harpullia petiolaris is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to warm, humid climates.
